oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-07-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 18, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys including Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Pap (Lonnie Wilson), Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Minnie Pearl, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Charming Betsy (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Columbus Stockade Blues (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Late Last Night My Willie Came Home (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Wilson, Lonnie; McGar, Mac; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys; Minnie Pearl; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Thompson, Tommy, 1923-2007; Cobb, David (Announcer);
